title: Research interests
text:
Research interests






📢 Join us!



We are currently looking and recruiting for M.Sc. or Ph.D. students!! You can contact us by email (ponsit.sat@gmail.com) or just walk in at our lab (BSc0204).


Our lab focuses on the study of functional genomics and epigenetics using Bioinformatics to elucidate the regulation of important phenotypes in various types of agricultural organisms including economical marine shrimp, durian, etc. The main goal is to introduce bioinformatics to investigate and explore functional genes involved in physiological and developmental processes and find out a way to improve productivity and increase the quantities and quality of agricultural organisms. We are studying many molecular biology levels using high-throughput data such as transcriptome, genotyping by sequencing, and bisulfite sequencing together with bioinformatics. Now, marine shrimp is one of our economic aquatic animals, and we are also working on economic plants such as durian collaborating with the Faculty of Natural Resource, PSU, and the Faculty of Technology and Community Development, TSU. We now provide a computer server that serves various types of bioinformatics analysis.





In addition, bacterial genomics and metagenomics using MinION (Nanopore sequencing technology) in the aspect of agriculture are in our interests.
Bioinformatics data provide several kinds of our scope of studies, particularly

Potential long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) and circular RNA (circRNA) studies in several stressed conditions.
Epigenetic study, in particular, DNA methylation study.
Development of DNA markers for important trait selection in plants and animals.
Develop the databases of Penaeid’s lncRNAs and SNPs.
Bacterial genome and metagenomics

We are also interested to use high-throughput technology in other organisms, such as Torch ginger, lotus, and pathogenic and probiotic microorganisms.


Collaborations

Biotec, NSTDA
Faculty of Natural Resources, PSU
Faculty of Technology and Community Development, TSU.
Institute of Molecular Bioscience, MU
Faculty of Science, CU

title: Members
text:
Assoc. Prof. Ponsit Sathapondecha, Ph.D.
Lecturer and principal investigator
He was born in Bangkok. He finished at Debsirin school, Bangkok before graduating with his Bachelor’s degree in Biology with 2nd honor class at Chulalongkorn University. Then, he finished his Master’s and Ph.D. in Molecular Genetics and Genetic Engineering at the Institute of Biosciences, Mahidol University. Since 2016 until now, he has been a lecturer at the Department of Molecular Biotechnology and Bioinformatics, Faculty of Science, Prince of Songkla University.













Prasert (Tom) Yodsawat, Ph.D. Student
He finished his BSc. (Biotechnology) and M.Sc. (Molecular Biotechnology and Bioinformatics) from the Department of Molecular Biotechnology and Bioinformatics, PSU. He is a bioinformatician who likes to explore novel strategies for bioinformatics in many aspects. Now, his project focuses on the interaction of microbiome and abiotic conditions for coffee plantation and production as well as the development of a friendly program for metatranscriptome analysis.







Therissara (Ploy) Klahan, M.Sc. Student
She finished her BSc. (Biotechnology) from the Department of Molecular Biotechnology and Bioinformatics, PSU. She worked as a scientist at the Faculty of Medicine, PSU, and Medical Technology Service Center (Phuket) for 2 years. Now, she is carrying out a project about genome and variant analysis of different Vibrio parahaemolyticus isolations and their virulent phenotype in white shrimp and is financially supported by a Research Assistant Scholarship from the Faculty of Science, PSU.







Pimpakan (Kam) Thongsen, M.Sc. Student

Phassorn (Thua) Suksri
B.Sc. in Biotechnology
She finished her B.Sc. Biotechnology from Faculty of Science, PSU. Now, her work is about performing the assessment of indigenous durian for drought-tolerant rootstock production, and shrimp feeding. She likes taking photography and listening to music.

Publications

title: Get in Touch with Us!
text:
Get in Touch with Us!
 





 
We are the Agricultural Biotech & Bioinformatics Laboratory, under the Division of Biological Science, Faculty of Science, Prince of Songkla University, Thailand.
 






 
Feel free to get in touch with us through email: ponsit.sat@gmail.com, or you can stop by our lab at the room Bsc0204, Basic Science (BSc) Building (อาคารเรียนและปฏิบัติการพื้นฐานทางวิทยาศาสตร์) 🙂
